title: Can't view ranked 5v5 teams schedule.
body: I couldn't find the option to start a ranked team so I clicked on the "League System FAQ" link.  At the top of that page, below the picture, it says, "Ranked 5v5 teams are available during scheduled windows per region. Servers with Ranked 3v3 enabled will also be available during that time. Click here to view the schedule."  When I click on the link to view the schedule it brings up the login page.  After logging in it says, "OOPS You're not authorized to access this page"  Is this a glitch/bug?  If not, why do I need authorization to access the schedule for when the option to create ranked 5v5 teams is available, and how do I get this authorization?

replies.body:
The page has been deleted because it's outdated, it just hasn't been removed from the list of results yet.

Ranked Teams are no more. Ranked Team queues are now Flex queues.

> #Twisted Treeline

You can queue up solo, as a duo or as a trio in the ranked Flex 3v3 queue (Twisted Treeline) now.

> #Summoner's Rift

You can queue up as solo, duo, trio or a quintet in the Flex 5v5 queue or as a solo or duo in the Solo/Duo queue.

For NA all ranked queues are enabled 24/7.

As *Rineyy* mentioned, Ranked Teams aren't a thing anymore, so you won't be able to access pages referencing it anymore. You should see the updates that were posted to the [**Ranked Play FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204010760-Ranked-Play-FAQ) that covers how ranked works now.

Let me know if you have any questions.
You people really need to start reading patch notes
I do read patch notes.  I must have overlooked this.
